articles.title: SA hockey men launch comeback to sink Germany, register 1st win in Tokyo - News24
articles.description: The South African men's hockey team have won their first match at the Tokyo Olympics, beating Germany on Thursday.
articles.content:
The South African men's hockey team have won their first match at the Tokyo Olympics after beating Germany 4-3 on Thursday.
LIVE |Tokyo Olympics - Day 6

articles.title: SA's Schoenmaker, Corbett set up dream Olympic final in 200m breaststroke - News24
articles.description: South African swimming duo Tatjana Schoenmaker and Kaylene Corbett have advanced to the women's 200m breaststroke final after winning their semi-finals in Tokyo.
articles.content:
South African swimming duo Tatjana Schoenmaker and Kaylene Corbett have advanced to the women's 200m breaststroke final at the Tokyo Olympics after winning their semi-finals on Thursday.

articles.content:

articles.title: Rwanda denies hacking Ramaphosa, but exiles in SA say spying is 'a way of life' - News24
articles.description: The Pegasus Project data leak revealed that President Cyril Ramaphosa may have been the target of Rwandan cyber hacking. While Kigali denies this, Rwandan exiles living in South Africa are unsurprised.
articles.content: Exiled from Rwanda since 1994, Etienne Mutabazi was not surprised to find his name on a leaked list of people targeted by Pegasus spyware. The lawyer and activist found himself in the company of Pres… [+689 chars]

articles.description: The Japanese capital saw 2,848 new coronavirus cases, topping its earlier record of 2,520 daily cases set on Jan. 7, the Associated Press reported.
articles.content:
